The meanings of flags

Steffi LaZerte

2017-09-21

library(weathercan)
library(dplyr)

What are flags

The data output of the weather() function include a corresponding _flag column for each data column. These columns are used by ECCC to add notes regarding measurements.

In the weather() function if format = TRUE (the default), data corresponding to flags M, NA, [empty] and L are all replaced with NA.

For example, a sample of unformated data from Magog station in Quebec looks like:

## # A tibble: 6 x 7
##   station_name station_id `Date/Time` `Total Precip (mm)`
##          <chr>      <dbl>       <chr>               <chr>
## 1        MAGOG       5401     2017-02                48.0
## 2        MAGOG       5401     2017-03                30.4
## 3        MAGOG       5401     2017-04               114.0
## 4        MAGOG       5401     2017-05                78.8
## 5        MAGOG       5401     2017-06               140.7
## 6        MAGOG       5401     2017-07                80.7
## # ... with 3 more variables: `Total Precip Flag` <chr>, `Snow Grnd Last
## #   Day (cm)` <chr>, `Snow Grnd Last Day Flag` <chr>

This same sample, formated looks like:

## # A tibble: 6 x 7
##   station_name station_id       date total_precip total_precip_flag
##          <chr>      <dbl>     <date>        <dbl>             <chr>
## 1        MAGOG       5401 2017-02-01         48.0                 ^
## 2        MAGOG       5401 2017-03-01         30.4                 ^
## 3        MAGOG       5401 2017-04-01        114.0                 ^
## 4        MAGOG       5401 2017-05-01         78.8                 ^
## 5        MAGOG       5401 2017-06-01        140.7                 ^
## 6        MAGOG       5401 2017-07-01         80.7                  
## # ... with 2 more variables: snow_grnd_last_day <dbl>,
## #   snow_grnd_last_day_flag <chr>

As you can see, the missing data flag (M) is now replaced with NA. The other flag ^ is not, as it indicates that “The value displayed is based on incomplete data” (see below).

Flags

knitr::kable(flags)
code meaning
E Estimated
M Missing
NA Not Available
‡ Partner data that is not subject to review by the National Climate Archives
A Accumulated
C Precipitation occurred, amount uncertain
F Accumulated and estimated
L Precipitation may or may not have occurred
N Temperature missing but known to be > 0
S More than one occurrence
T Trace
Y Temperature missing but known to be < 0
[empty] No data available
^ The value displayed is based on incomplete data
† Data for this day has undergone only basic quality checking
B More than one occurrence and estimated
